summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel approval requests and logistical issues for trips related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail planning for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, and reference prior trips to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach for victim interviews.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial travel approval request for the Epstein investigation, identifying the case as United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: SDNY team plans to travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation. The emails detail flight and hotel booking logistics.

events.title: Prior Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Reference to a prior approved trip to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) in connection with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: Reference to a prior approved trip to Los Angeles for an interview on November 14, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to West Palm Beach for Interview
events.description: Reference to a prior approved trip to West Palm Beach for an interview on November 4, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to Los Angeles for Victim Interview
events.description: Reference to a prior approved trip to Los Angeles for a victim interview in the Epstein investigation, tentatively scheduled for a week in June 2019.

events.title: Prior Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Reference to a prior approved trip to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prior Travel to Florida for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Reference to the initial travel approval request for United States v. Epstein for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY) U.S. Attorney's Office
keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618,' described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
The SDNY team was actively conducting victim interviews in multiple locations (Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Stockholm) as part of the Epstein investigation in 2019 and early 2020.
Travel for the investigation required specific approvals and adherence to government travel policies, such as booking refundable tickets for international flights.
The email chain reveals internal logistical friction and miscommunication within the SDNY office regarding flight bookings for the Sweden trip.
The document shows the investigation was active and involved international travel for interviews well after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
